Reference

excel_utilities.getExcelSheet(inputfile)

Retrieves data from an excel file

Parameters

inputfile – The excel file you want to retriece data from.

Returns

sheet

Return type

<class ‘openpyxl.worksheet.worksheet.Worksheet’>

Note

The getExcelSheet function is used to retrieve data form an excel file. In order to do so, the openpyxl library is used!

excel_utilities.getSheetNames

To retrieve a tuple containting the column names (default, use b_rows=True to retrieve the row names instead) of the specified excel spreadsheet you can use the excel_utilities.getSheetNames function:

excel_utilities.getSheetNames(sheet, b_rows=False)

Return a tuple of column names as strings

Parameters

  • sheet (<class 'openpyxl.worksheet.worksheet.Worksheet'>) – Required excel spreadsheet.

  • b_rows (Boolean) – Optional, set to True in order to return row names instead.

Raises

excel_utilities.InvalidSheetError – If the sheet argument is an invalid type.

Returns

The column names tuple.

Return type

tuple(str)

The sheet parameter should be retrieved using the excel_utilities.getExcelSheet.
Otherwise, excel_utilities.getSheetNames() will raise an exception.
exception excel_utilities.InvalidSheetError

Raised if the sheet argument is an invalid type. openpyxl does not support file format, please check you can open it with Excel first. Supported formats are: .xlsx,.xlsm,.xltx,.xltm

excel_utilities.getDataList

To etrieve a list of lists. Each sublist containts the values, provided by the specified excel spreadsheet, of each column (default, use b_rows=True to retrieve values of rows instead).

Note

The first value of each column is scipped due to being the column name. You can retrieve column names using the excel_utilities.getSheetNames function.

excel_utilities.getDataList(sheet, b_rows=False)

Return a list of columns

Parameters

  • sheet (<class 'openpyxl.worksheet.worksheet.Worksheet'>) – Required excel spreadsheet.

  • b_rows (Boolean) – Optional, set to True in order to retrieve lists of rows instead of columns.

Raises

excel_utilities.InvalidSheetError – If the sheet argument is an invalid type.

Returns

A list of lists

Return type

list()

The sheet parameter should be retrieved using the excel_utilities.getExcelSheet.
Otherwise, excel_utilities.getDataList will raise an exception.

excel_utilities.getDataDict

To retrieve a dictionary, where keys are the names of each column and the values are the values of that column.

getDataDict(sheet, col_names, data_list_row)

Return the values of the specified excel spreadsheet as a dictionary.

Parameters

  • sheet (<class 'openpyxl.worksheet.worksheet.Worksheet'>) – Required excel spreadsheet.

  • col_names (tuple(str)) – The name of each column that will be set as keys in the dictionary. Can be retrived using the excel_utilities.getSheetNames() function.

  • data_list_row (list()) – The values of the columns, besides the first row which contains the column names. Can be retrieved using the excel_utilities.getDataList() function.

Raises

excel_utilities.InvalidSheetError – If the sheet argument is an invalid type.

Returns

A dictionary

Return type

dict

stats_proc.arithMean_col

stats_proc.arithMean_col(columnName, col_names, data_list_columns)

Return the arithmetic of a list.

Parameters

  • columnName (str) – The name of the column of which the function computes the arithmetic mean.

  • col_names (tuple(str)) – The name of each column. Can be retrived using the excel_utilities.getSheetNames() function.

  • data_list_columns (list()) – The values of the columns, besides the first row which contains the column names. Can be retrieved using the excel_utilities.getDataList() function.

Returns

The value of the arithmetic mean of a column.

Return type

float

stats_proc.median

stats_proc.median(columnName, col_names, data_list_columns)

Return the median of a list

Parameters

  • columnName (str) – The name of the column of which the function computes the median.

  • col_names (tuple(str)) – The name of each column. Can be retrived using the excel_utilities.getSheetNames function.

  • data_list_columns (list()) – The values of the columns, besides the first row which contains the column names. Can be retrieved using the excel_utilities.getDataList function.

Returns

The value of the median of a column.

Return type

float

stats_proc.stat_mode

stats_proc.stat_mode(columnName, col_names, data_list_columns)

Return the statistical mode of a list

Parameters

  • columnName (str) – The name of the column of which the function computes the mode.

  • col_names (tuple(str)) – The name of each column. Can be retrived using the excel_utilities.getSheetNames function.

  • data_list_columns (list()) – The values of the columns, besides the first row which contains the column names. Can be retrieved using the excel_utilities.getDataList function.

Returns

The value of the mode of a column.

Return type

float

graph_creator_func

graph_creator_func(inputfile)

Returns a number of histograms, one for each value retrieved by the excel_utilities.getSheetNames function. The Y-axis is the range of the values accordingly.
